response.overview: "Rockwell Kent" a documentary by Frederick Lewis As seen on PBS The Washington Post called this two-part 170 minute labor of love, "a sweeping, detailed, visually rich portrait of a man who emerges as a complex, compelling and finally contradictory force of nature, a charismatic reflection of the eras in which he lived, from the radical political culture of the 1930s to the movement toward abstraction and expressionism that left his representational paintings behind." Shot on location in Alaska, Newfoundland, Ireland, Denmark, Russia, Greenland, Argentina and Chile (Cape Horn).
response.title: Rockwell Kent
